<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofpr </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.75</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Environment </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>



</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>serverExec</name>=<value> server </value></part><part><name>Exec</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Set rain density smoothly over the given transition time (in seconds). A transition time of zero means an immediate change.
A rain density of zero is no rain, one is maximum rain. Rain is not possible when [[overcast]] is less than 0.7.

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature arma3 </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Since <template><title>arma3</title></template> this command is MP synchronised:
* If executed on server, the changes will propagate globally.
* If executed on client, the effect is temporary and will soon change to the server setting.
Minimum [[overcast]] needed for rain in <template><title>arma3</title></template> is '''0.5'''.</value></part></template></value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> time [[setRain]] rain </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> time: [[Number]] - transition time to the new value in seconds </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> rain: [[Number]] - new rain value in range 0...1 </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>60 [[setRain]] 1;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Force no rain: <code>0 [[setRain]] 0;
[[forceWeatherChange]];
999999 [[setRain]] 0;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part><part><name> mp </name>=<value> Pre-Arma 3, each client and the server could have different rain values. </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[overcast]], [[setOvercast]], [[rain]], [[nextWeatherChange]], [[forceWeatherChange]], [[setFog]]  </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 16, 2016 - 22:06 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Using '''Example 2''' on dedicated server might need additional interference on JIP clients. The reason is that JIP has [[rain]] value > 0 slowly changing to 0. To force client to sync one can execute this on client: <code>[[skipTime]] 1; [[skipTime]] -1;</code>
</dd>
</dl>
